Notes.Text:
This update for librelp fixes the following issues:
  CVE-2018-1000140 (bsc#1086730):
  librelp contained a stack-based buffer overflow in the checking of x509 certificates.
  A remote attacker with an access to the rsyslog logging facility could have exploited
  it by sending a specially crafted x509 certificate.
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP3
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP3

Vulnerabilities.Description: rsyslog librelp version 1.2.14 and earlier contains a Buffer Overflow vulnerability in the checking of x509 certificates from a peer that can result in Remote code execution. This attack appear to be exploitable a remote attacker that can connect to rsyslog and trigger a stack buffer overflow by sending a specially crafted x509 certificate.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP3:librelp0-1.2.12-3.3.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP3:librelp-devel-1.2.12-3.3.1
